website_summaries.verdict: A professional-looking backpack with numerous pockets and notable style – if you want a practical backpack that complements your style, this is the top pick.
pros: Good-looking and lightweight, yet offers a reasonable amount of space for your laptop and other items
The slim profile won't weigh you down or look bulky paired with your professional attire
cons: The main opening is a bit tight
Fit may be too tight for larger laptops

customer_reviews.title: Plastic?!!  Wrong Choice!
customer_reviews.text: Overall this bag is great. That being said, all the zippers and sewing seem to be high quality yet they've used plastic hooks for the shoulder straps. 1 year in and one of them has broken rendering the bag useless for the way I use it, which is daily. I travel frequently and don't intend to carry it like a briefcase. Pretty disappointed after spending over $100 and only getting a year from it. I've spent less and gotten years of service from other laptop computer bags. I give it 3 stars because other than this quality issue it's a great bag and well constructed. Still puzzled about the cheap plastic considering the way the rest was constructed.
customer_reviews.author: JWitt

customer_reviews.title: It’s falling apart - how can I get a replacement?
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used the bag (lightly) for 2 1/2 mmonths and the mesh on the water bottle pocket is torn and frayed. I really like the bag - the look, size, pockets, ability to stow the backpack straps, etc. My only complaint (until now) has been that the zippered water bottle pocket is not well designed, as it does not zip and unzip easily (it’s a chore). Consequently, I don’t use it often. Last week I opened it up to use and noticed the webbing coming apart. ;-( Since I bought it through Amazon and not E-Bags directly, I don’t know how to get a replacement. Thoughts???
customer_reviews.author: A Mom in Mass

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS BACKPACK - must read
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for the authentic eBags Professional Slim Laptop Backpack that has tons of YouTube reviews...this is NOT it. The price is higher, the zippers are subpar, the quality is lower, the bottom pocket does not come with the "box" to add rigidity, and there is no side handle to convert into a briefcase like the authentic eBags backpack. This is a cheap Vietnamese knockoff at a higher price. I will be placing an order on the eBags website and returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Broken zipper & poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but poor execution. Those zippers they brag about aren't a good as they seem. My broke after 6 weeks and don't get me started regarding ebags poor customer service. There are lots of computer bags/backpacks available. Don't spend you money on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the same.
customer_reviews.text: This isn’t the bag that’s been so highly rated on Amazon for so long. As others mentioned it was cheapened greatly. I was looking forward to the ability to hide the straps and use as a brief case on business trips. Also, the way the entire bag slid over a suit case roll top handle. Now it’s a cheap strap holding it to a suit case and a thinner bag with no way to hold horizontal. Skip this one there’s better bags out there.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Amazing travel backpack!
customer_reviews.text: The thing I like most about this backpack is the fact that it can store a lot of stuff and I can still find it all! The zippers for the ipad pocket, the laptop pocket, and the other opening are different and after the first trip I remembered which was which without having to think about it. The front pocket, with all its zippered pouches is great because you can easily see what is there. The bag looks professional and qualified as a "personal item" on the airlines I flew with, so I could carry a roller bag as well. Easily fits under the seat but is sturdy enough that I felt OK putting it in the overhead bin.
customer_reviews.author: Adele

customer_reviews.title: Favorite laptop bag!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing backpack if you're having storage space issues. Very nice quality. Love the look of the bag. I have zero complaints. Probably my favorite's laptop bag ever
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: There is a nice little pocket on the bottom that is great for ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for work purposes. I was tired of carrying around the satchel style briefcase and am in and out of airports frequently. I picked this one up because it is not bulky and has a stylish look to it. There is a pocket for my Microsoft Surface and another pocket for my portable monitor. There is a nice little pocket on the bottom that is great for quick access to all my power cable and the front pocket has plenty of space for all my accessories and writing utensils. If you like the style of this bag I highly reccomend it!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Durham

customer_reviews.title: An excellent business backpack I've ever used!
customer_reviews.text: The great backpack for business traveller which I've ever experienced! Crush Proof compartment and lots of utility pockets are exceedingly good! There wasn't any description about rain-proof, but I noticed that this item is surely functional in repelling rain drops, even though I could not test it thoroughly so far. Pros: 1. Crush Proof, rain-proof 2. slim backpack 3. It looks sturdy, making the pack not looking distorted with heavy load. Cons: I can not notice any as yet.
customer_reviews.author: Sungwook Kim

customer_reviews.title: Not the bag it used to be!
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered this bag in October 2018 and I love it! Slim and functional, it is the perfect travel bag for me. My father complimented me on the bag, so I purchased one for him for Christmas in December 2019. We were disappointed to discover several changes to the bag design. The backpack straps can no longer be hidden, and there is no handle to allow the bag to be held horizontally (like a briefcase). Also my original bag included a hardcase to store power cords and adapters, and that feature is no longer included. Some advice to Ebags - if it ain't broke, don't fix it!
customer_reviews.author: LV Niteowl

customer_reviews.title: Good bag, not enough space.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, a decent bag (I bought directly from eBags). Ive been using it for about two months now and it has held up pretty well. I love the organizational concept, the “garage”, and the hidden iPad pocket. My biggest complaint is this bag just falls short when it comes to actually packing it decently full. You can only get so much in the bag before other pockets get compressed and become useless. This would have been solved with maybe 1-2 more inches of depth, or an option to expand the bag (like on suitcases). Overall I like the bag, but I just wish it could hold more.
customer_reviews.author: stonefamily

customer_reviews.title: BEST Laptop Bag I've had
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through back-pack style bags, believe me. Even gave away a Tumi bag that just didn't cut it. This eBag product is attractive, strong, and capacious without looking like a sloppy school book bag. I can load it with my work laptop and accessories (mi-fi, work phone, and notebook) and still have room for my planner (yep a paper planner) and maybe a sandwich for lunch in there. The weight distribution feels even if I do wear it, but the padded handle on the top lets me carry it most of the time, which is perfect. I really haven't got an complaints about this bag at all.
customer_reviews.author: The Lizzie Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Less convertible as a travel bag
customer_reviews.text: eBags has removed the side handle and the tuck away pocket for the straps. This makes the bag difficult as a flight carry on and stowing. Construction seems well made and plenty of pockets for stuff. However, this does not have secure features on the pockets. Since you have to wear it through airports and travel destinations it is very easy for someone to unzip the pockets, steal you phone, tablet and laptop without you knowing it. Just purchase several TSA approved locks for all the zippers.
customer_reviews.author: Lorax

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack for business.  Just a few too many zippers and compartments.
customer_reviews.text: Great backpack. Smaller than average, so fits under plane seats wonderfully. Its size keeps you from packing the kitchen sink, so it stays light. I Like the trendy color options and the water bottle holder. Very comfortable to wear. My only real complaint is there are too many compartments and zippers. You think you're being organized by putting certain items in different compartments, then you find yourself in a customer meeting zipping & un-zipping 20 times looking for a cable or a USB thumb drive. It gets annoying. I'd prefer to have 1 or 2 main zippers, and then easy to use compartments within them. All-in-all, good backpack.
customer_reviews.author: R. EARLS

customer_reviews.title: Almost a good bag. Delivered with defects
customer_reviews.text: Bag quality is amazing except one of my internal pockets did not have the mesh correctly stitched and was already coming apart when I first took the bag out of the delivery box.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Brandeburg

customer_reviews.title: The best travel bag I've used
customer_reviews.text: Watch Ebag's video that accompanies this bag's listing to see all of its neat tricks, like the compartment at the bottom to stow charging cables which also happens to provide enough stability for the bag to stand on its own when empty. I took this thing across the country and back, and it is easily the best bag I've used. I took my MacBook Pro 15", Nintendo Switch, iPad Pro 9" and various paperwork without trouble. I did have a tough time getting my Surface Headphones in there though - they come in a large carrying case.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Great Business Pack
customer_reviews.text: I travel 100,000 miles a year. Always looking for the perfect backpack. This comes close. Easy to get at my cords and my travel documents. I have bought eBags Motherload suitcases and they are outstanding so I tried this backpack. I was not disappointed. I love the quick access for my iPad. One upgrade would be a built in phone pouch. Then it may be perfect. It also comes in great colors that don’t look like every other backpack out there. Update: the water bottle holder mesh quickly started to tear and separate. Now I have a backpack in fine shape but can’t carry a coffee or water container.
customer_reviews.author: K. Newcomb

customer_reviews.title: Best thin bag period!!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you want a high quality bag and a competitive and value price look no further. Best thing for me about this bag is the ability to storage items without them crashing to the bottom of the bag for a mix party. The pockets and zippers are awesome. You will get to a place of putting things were you get them quickly. No more searching and untangling. Bag keeps its shape will being storage and on your back so comfort is awesome. Even if it was 200 instead of 100 would be a strong value. If you prefer function over brand get this bag
customer_reviews.author: PeteyPabloAtl

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to purchase an EBag due to the price. However, I’m so glad I did. I love this bag! I have severe allergies and have meds which need to go everywhere with me. The EBag fits everything I had in my old backpack in two pockets and keeps everything organized....I no longer have to dump my backpack to find my epi pen. The cord garage is also great. It holds all my adapters and cords plus two large battery packs. I rarely use the the three large compartments as the cord garage and front two pockets hold a ton of stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Leaha

customer_reviews.title: As close to the perfect bag as I have yet found!
customer_reviews.text: In the ever elusive search for the perfect bag this one comes as close as any of them ever have. It looks neat and not all sloppy like some do. It is actually able to stand up on its end much better than any other bag I’ve had. The bottom compartment is where I keep my power charge and components and you can access it from inside And outside. A lot of thought went into the layout of this and it looks very professional.
customer_reviews.author: Loren Lyons

customer_reviews.title: Stitching is coming undone.... :(
customer_reviews.text: The look of the bag is great! The functionality is great too. I've bragged on this bag many times. If you're wondering why I only gave it 2 stars, it's because the stitching on the front pocket is coming undone. I'd expect that from a cheap bag.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Suter

customer_reviews.title: Nice backpack for your 17inch.
customer_reviews.text: First there is no side strap to carry like a suitcase. Second you can not hide the back straps. That being said, it appears to be well made. Plenty of room your an additional tablet phone and other items, as well as power supply adapter. Wish it was able to carry a lap top cooler. We shall see how it holds up, figure it will last longer than me.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Best tech/work bag I can find for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit heavy when empty , and even heavier when i stuff all my things that i need on a daily basis in it, But..... It's the best tech/Work bag I have found , it has so many useful pockets , and I love the charger garage, I stuff my charger and mx master 3 in there no problem. has plenty of padding for laptops and tablets , I love the lined tablet pocket, I stick my glasses , my inhaler , and other stuff in there. for a little while I even put my gun in there , but I have lately relocated that to the storage are so that I can feel safer with my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie V.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for travel
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use on an overseas trip. I normally carry my computer and stuff in a soft-sided brief case but wanted the back-pack format to carry the computer on this overseas vacation trip. It worked very well - the 15inch Dell Precision computer was well protected. The front flap opens to carry multiple other small items. The other inside compartment I carried small books or a light jacket. The small compartment at the bottom for electrical cables and chargers was also handy. Quality of zippers was good. As an older person, I liked the design better than the college backpack look. Overall would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Great computer/electronics/overnight bag.
customer_reviews.text: I also have the larger version of this bag (the weekender) and travel 3-5 days with it. This one has a lot of the same features, but is really just an overnight bag. Maybe two nights if you push it. Great pocket layout, great separators, good quality so far. As others have said the bottle carrier is meh, but I just keep snacks in there anyways. I recommend getting some of the eBags packing cubes, they fit perfectly in their bags. All in all, a great computer/electronic gear/overnight bag that looks good enough to take into business meetings.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely freaking love it!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an upgrade from an old messenger style bag (limited capacity, bulky, starting to show wear/tear). I was in the market for a laptop bag, but wanted something with a slimmer profile and still functional for work/grad school. I transferred the contents of my old bag into this one, and not only did I have tons of room to spare, this bag was actually slimmer than my old one. Every feature is well thought out, and I especially love the AC adapter garage. The video is pretty comprehensive, but I highly recommend giving it a try..
customer_reviews.author: metacyde

customer_reviews.title: Best backpack I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best backpack I have ever owned. This backpack is perfectly designed for those who crave cord and device management without the clutter of a bloated overgrown backpack that you can barely fit underneath an airplane seat and almost never find what your looking for while you dig deeper and deeper into the bag abyss hoping to feel your way to the power that will save your phone from shutting itself off. The profile of this backpack screams business with its sleek multifunctional features. This backpack quite simply kicks ass. Stop shopping, save some time and buy this. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: goblufever

customer_reviews.title: I like the features and the thought that has gone into ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the features and the thought that has gone into the backpack, but it's just too small for my needs. You can't really put anything extra into this pack beyond papers, laptop and some misc. things that are small. I wanted to downsize, but this is too small. Things I do like - the ability to put this over my carry-on luggage with the strap on the back, the front pocket where I'd put my phone/ID, and the "garage" at the bottom for small items I don't want crushed. It's a solid bag and I think it's a great bag in design use for some folks, but it's not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Teale

customer_reviews.title: Bizarre design
customer_reviews.text: Very well made bag but poorly designed. The zippers only go down one side, which makes getting gear in and out difficult. The spaces in the larger pockets are oddly shaped given the zippers. There are a zillion tiny pockets in the front but if you fill them, you take up all of the space in the adjacent pocket. It’s great if you only want to carry a few things and it looks nice. Not great for one who likes great space efficiency.
customer_reviews.author: EE

customer_reviews.title: ... a flight to So Padre Island & it worked great.
customer_reviews.text: Used for the 1st time on a flight to So Padre Island & it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Corona

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect backpack - scratchy straps will burn your shoulders
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is great in that it helps keep you organized, there’s a pocket for everything, it stays thin and streamlined, and has a “slide over the pulley of your suitcase” option. It slides nicely under the seat in front of you on an airplane. It’s professional looking, and i clip my keys to the strap when riding my bike with it, which is very convenient. Now that it’s warm out and I’ve been wearing tank tops, I’m removing a star for the material that lines the straps and the padding on the back. It’s scratchy! I feel like i have a rug burn on my shoulders. I’m looking at Sherpani bags from REI for a better summer option.
customer_reviews.author: CourtneyP

customer_reviews.title: Ok - not great
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. Not great. The interior pockets are nylon, and I would like a soft material for placing laptops and other similar items into. The pockets inside are slack, so when you go to slip a something into it, it always get caught on the loose pocket lip.its a real pain. I also find the zippers to be a bit stiff. The quick easy-access front is incredibly useful - much better than the messenger bag this replaces. I have yet to find a really smart backpack/laptop bag that has the complete attention to detail. It appears all too few people test these out during product development.
customer_reviews.author: Barango

customer_reviews.title: After all these years.
customer_reviews.text: This is the ultimate backpack. After years of trying every backpack around (hate to think of the dollars wasted) I finally have the perfect bag. Everything fits and is securely stored. There is no more of the immediate sag that you have from other bags. No digging for things; open the zipper and it is right there. It is professional looking; no more looking like a 6th grader with your backpack down at your knees. Love the fact that you can stow the straps and carry it as a briefcase. Now have to order another for my son who tried to steal mine.
customer_reviews.author: K. McManes

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack for college
customer_reviews.text: This is great for college students needing to lug around a laptop for class or those who travel a lot and need to be able to quickly remove their laptop while going through security. It is fairly spacious with more than enough pockets for all of the little odds and ends that you may need, e.g. pencils, erasers, charging cords, etc. My only real complaints are that the main pocket is a little smaller than I had originally expected, I can only fit about four or so standard-sized spiral bound notebooks in there and that the external zippered pocket for holding a drink container is not very expandable.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Cannot fit much in the main compartment if you use the front organization pocket.
customer_reviews.text: If you want a thin, quick trip travel bag, this is probably great for you. I work in IT and thought the front organization would be amazing. And it is. But the more you put in the front pocket, the more this main pocket shrinks. To the point where the top or the main compartment can't hold much more than a shirt or two with the front pocket packed with cables, mouse, external hard drive, ect. The quality and durability of the pack seems good. But if you actually want to load it up, look elsewhere. It could use a Velcro strap on the laptop pocket as well, but that's a minor concern.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Ueltschi

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel and everyday use
customer_reviews.text: Ive been using this bag for about a year and it is holding up extremely well. I expect it will last a long time. I do sometimes wish it could stand up better by itself but I love the overall slim design more so it is a trade off. The numerous pockets are helpful but sometimes a little unnecessary. And it’s big enough that I can fit everything I need in it but not overly bulky. Great design, great backpack.
customer_reviews.author: adamm

customer_reviews.title: They have my back
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value, well made, good quality. It is advertised for travel, school & business; and I agree with two of the three, however unless you are a very light traveler, you'll be limited to a laptop, iPad, some paperwork, and a pair of underwear. I use mine for work and love the small compartment in the front in which I put my computer glasses. Overall, very nicely made. p.s. maybe two pair of underwear if they're made of silk :-)
customer_reviews.author: Curt A. Siebert

customer_reviews.title: Perfect back for work and business travel.
customer_reviews.text: I use this bag daily to carry my laptop to work. It looks more professional than a regular soft-sided backpack because it has a little more structure to it. The straps can be hidden and the bag can be carried by its side handle to make it NOT look like a backpack. I have used it for business travel as well and it is comfortable to wear when rushing through an airport. Easy access to the laptop and easy access to papers.n I would recommend this bag to any of my colleagues who carry a laptop daily.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Meade

customer_reviews.title: Good for work. Not for traveling.
customer_reviews.text: Im very picky about back packs. I purchased this bag intending to use it for light weight traveling. I could fit some clothes (no shoes/only sandals) at the help with compression packing bags. Otherwise it would not be good for traveling. This backpack is meant for work related items like holding folders/papers/tablets/laptops. If you require a back for such, this is for you!!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Panchevre

customer_reviews.title: Great for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: I love this backpack. It's become my everyday backpack that I use to carry my gear to my office everyday. I fit my MacBook Pro, iPad Pro with magic keyboard, my cable organizer bag, my Nintendo Switch, my Bose speaker, mouse, a 3 outlet + 2 usb charger extension cord, and my hootoo travel router. It all fits nicely and because it's slim the weight is balanced well. I've had backpacks where the weight was distributed far out away from my body and it makes the backpack painful to wear if traveling for a long time. This backpack is amazing so far!
customer_reviews.author: ScooterLovesSD

customer_reviews.title: The last bag I'll ever need!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! What a bag - hold everything in such an organized fashion. I initiated this bag on a business trip to Europe and packed everything - PC, Kindle, Bose headphones, freshen up kit, brush, snakc -- you get the idea - and I still had room. The best feature is that everything has a place making finding things in the orange pockets a breeze. I can't say enough about it- you will not be disappointed in this purchase. All the wonderful reviews are true true true!
customer_reviews.author: E. Perlin

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I was really torn over purchasing this bag because it was more than I wanted to spend. But everytime I started my search over based on the features I needed (slim design, separate laptop pocket that is padded, professional looking, black, water bottle pocket...) I kept coming back to this bag. I bought it about 6 weeks ago and it's been perfect. I work out of a few different locations as well as consulting/speaking work in the community. This bag can hold all my essentials (extra cords, mouse, presentation clicker, pens, business cards, mints, file folders...) and keeps them all organized in a neat little bag that holds its shape. I'm so glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Coming apart after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought this bag is great, but now after 3-4 months, some stitching is separating on the outside and it is coming apart inside as well. I don't think I've been too rough with this bag. I'm dissappointed and now it's too late to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Amazing travel bag!
customer_reviews.text: I really have enjoyed this bag. I had a Swiss Army for over 10 years that I used for work and travel that need replacing. I chose this eBag after reading the reviews, like this one, and don't regret the switch at all!! Plenty of room and pockets for travel purposes; the sunglasses pouch is seriously appreciated. Only Con is that it wont stand up on its own when set upright on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: VanWlder1

customer_reviews.title: Great For Business Traveler!
customer_reviews.text: My husband who is 67 had old fashion briefcase. It was difficult maneuvering through airports trying to carry briefcase and roll luggage. This gives him hands free and a big plus is all the different compartments that allows him to sort all his items without having to dig down in the bottom of a briefcase. Very durable. This is a great product you won't go wrong buying it!
customer_reviews.author: Beach Goer

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking tech bag.
customer_reviews.text: All around decent tech bag just not sure why there is a gap with zippers. The gap scares me if it is raining. An easy way for water to get in. Plastic clasps for shoulder straps are not as sturdy as I expected. 2-week international travel showed me that it wasnt as worthy as i expected. 2 days after Return date finally back in the country and totally regret purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. Meeker

customer_reviews.title: Docking 2 stars because it's heavier than a bag of bricks... even when it's empty.
customer_reviews.text: Well made, but absurdly heavy. Docking 2 stars. I'm a big guy, and this is the first bag, in my life, that I ever considered to be too heavy to wear comfortably. Also, the main compartment has an inner pocket that is simply too baggy and often snags when I try to put in my laptop, forcing me to use 2 hands (one to put in the laptop, and the other to hold the overly-loose inner compartment from catching on the laptop. If you want your enemy to develop a shoulder joint problem, anonymously gift them this backpack.
customer_reviews.author: D. Stamatis

customer_reviews.title: Thoughtful design and low profile. Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I have done a ton of research before purchasing this bag. Well designed, perfect for the business traveler. I travel 3 times per month Good quality, low profile and attention to detail. Removable cushion to protect laptop at bottom of the bag. Netted pockets. Separate compartment for tablet. I fit a laptop, USB monitor, tablet and all of my charging gear without a problem. Bag maintains its structure. Hard case compartment at the bottom of the bag fits laptop charger and my sunglass case. I made this choice over a Tumi and I’m extremely happy. Also easily slips onto luggage handle 99.00 is a small investment to protect your gear
customer_reviews.author: Renee & Alexa

customer_reviews.title: So great, I had to get my nephew one!
customer_reviews.text: I have this previous model in black and I love it! It still works great after 3 years and looks fantastic. I got this one as a sturdy bag to carry expensive electronics (laptop, tablets, chargers) and the wide opening makes it easy to remove devices for security checks. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Jason C

customer_reviews.title: Professional Briefcase alternative
customer_reviews.text: I’m an Administrative Nursing Supervisor. I need a working administrative bag that was not a briefcase. This bag is fantastic. Holds all my admin stuff plus a few other “Gray man” items. Do nut overstuff. It forces me to be specific about the gear i need to carry. It is a good looking bag. I wish it included a rainsleeve. I bought a 3rd party on in orange to match the interior liner. I will purchase the weekender next.
customer_reviews.author: WitchDoktah

customer_reviews.title: Excellent nice quality
customer_reviews.text: It is a really nice bag and I like that it holds its shape and doesn't collapse like a duffle bag. I put my 28oz bottle in the large front area sitting on the ledge, where I put my wires that are accessible from the bottom front. Definitely happy I bought it and the quality seems great after using it for several months. Update after 2+ yrs: I have never had a bag last this long. Zippers work great, no failures to speak of. Every now and then I get the urge to buy a new bag to just have something different but can't justify the dollars. I kind of wish it would fail.
customer_reviews.author: Chugger

customer_reviews.title: This bag is great! There is plenty of space for a several ...
customer_reviews.text: This bag is great! There is plenty of space for a several files or notebooks, a laptop, tablet, and various othrt accessories and it does not look bulky! I love the compartment on he bottom for chargers. There is plenty of room for a laptop charger, phone charger, Ethernet cord, and computer lock chain. The backpack straps fold underneath the back piece to make it more sleek looking if you're carrying it. I added a shoulder strap bag from a previous laptop bag so I can have the option to carry t on my back or like a laptop bag depending on where I'm going.
customer_reviews.author: Nikee Giampietro

customer_reviews.title: A Great Travel Backpack
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for an overseas trip and it is just a great backpack. I liked the handle when I could carry it like a brief case. Excellent padding and was comfortable when using as a backpack. Easy to store under the seat and it was easy to find whatever I was looking for. I really like how it helped me to organize all my stuff and especially all the cords. I needed to have a backpack that looked professional and this one fit the bill nicely. I use it for all my trips, even nationally now.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Dexter

customer_reviews.title: This is great for books and a computer, not much of a serious commuter bag.
customer_reviews.text: I love the constructed feel and the reinforcement of the different compartments, but once I get my laptop and a few books and notebooks in there there's not much room in there. If you're looking to carry extra clothes, computer accessories, lunch, etc in it, I'd suggest you look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Son of a Vondruke

customer_reviews.title: Laptop compartment not as large as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Good quality bag with regard to materials, cannot fault it there - however we bought it based on the 12.25" width in the laptop compartment and when we tried our larger than average laptop it simply didn't fit even with the padded removable piece removed. Width is consistently 11.25" across and we measured at multiple spots top, mid and bottom Height (without internal bottom pad) and the depth matched the specs Very disappointing and it will be returned
customer_reviews.author: Udella

customer_reviews.title: The best backpack/briefcase for all your electronics!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back pack for my fiance who travels for work. He wasn't thrilled to receive this as a gift because he felt he didn't need it. Now he has it on him at all times and loves it. He carries his laptop, cell phone, iPad, Canon T6i camera, 3 lenses, all necessary chords /cables /battery packs, mouse, external hard drive and more, all in the one back pack. He especially likes that he can carry it like a briefcase. One of the best laptop backpacks I've ever seen!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT DESIGN!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The design of this bag is so, so flexible, it will seem custom made for you! It is wonderfully compact, but holds a ton of stuff because the different zippered compartments, pockets and sleeves are so well organized. I'm extremely happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: mark caraccia

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Love the bag but the first time I whet to use it I noticed it only had 3 strap locations instead of 4. This is an obvious omission missed by quality control. I will order a replacement in hopes that it has all 4 strap locations next time.
customer_reviews.author: Fins Fan

customer_reviews.title: So Compact
customer_reviews.text: It is so compact. I can have all my books and my laptop in here and barely feel it because it compresses everything close to your bag. Looks good and is quite functional. The only drawback is that it doesn't fit non-flat things too much (like clothes for travelling etc. Unless you're smart and you pack it flat. O wait nvm i'm just dumb back to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Blanchard

customer_reviews.title: Best work/travel bag I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag for a more professional laptop bag that was stylish and easy to travel with that would break my back from all that sagging you get with traditional backpacks. Ebags definitely delivered. I have had it for a little over 2 months now and use it every single day. All the compartments make it so easy to organize my stuff and the material is so easy to keep clean. It is sleek and stylish as well as maintains its shape. My husband and I both own one and we are very pleased. We will be ordering more from ebags soon the quality can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: I love this bag and I highly recommend this bag to ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for this kind bag that has a separate compartment for my laptop charger, battery pack, phone charger and mouse to avoid mixing up with my other stuff. Finally, after almost 2 weeks of searching, I found this bag! All my expectations have been exceeded by whoever designed this bag! I love this bag and I highly recommend this bag to my friends and colleagues that carry their laptops everyday to work! The design of the pockets is awesome! I am very proud of my bag and very satisfied! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: DEREK

customer_reviews.title: Slim and lightweight backpack
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sleek and classy backpack that I keep near me throughout my day at work. In it, I carry a Lenovo laptop and some files, and whatever book I happen to be reading. The quality is excellent, and all the pockets work as advertised. The only reason I gave it four stars overall is that there seems to be no way to tuck in the extra length of the straps somewhere to get them out of the way. They hang loose (much longer than the photos indicate) and could be a tripping hazard.
customer_reviews.author: Quantum Mechanic

customer_reviews.title: The negatives are the same things that make this bag great!
customer_reviews.text: The great thing about this bag is all the variety of compartments that helps me organize my things. The bad thing about this bag is all the variety of compartments that causes me to loose my things. The great thing about this bag is all the cushion that keeps my things safe and my back comfortable. The bad thing about this bag is all the cushion that takes up much of the bag so there is less room for my things. But I like it. It doesn't look cheap or chincy. It has the look and feel of a quality bag from a top designer. ( I might replace the small "ebags" logo with a designer brand... just for fun.
customer_reviews.author: M. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Newer version - significantly cheaper quality
customer_reviews.text: I had a version I purchased a couple years ago. Had felt lined pocket for valuable, sturdy zipper pulls, and better quality materials. This one I purchased last week is just a cheaper all around version of materials. Pretty significant quality drop. I’m sure it’s fine, but it isn’t what it was.
customer_reviews.author: drewmd

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect bag for travel.
customer_reviews.text: The bag is a great size. I found the pocket at the bottom to be an awkward size so I just collapsed it. I wish the cable organizer pockets were a little thicker, they are mesh down flat. They would be easier to use if they were pouches with some extra material. I also wish the bag was about 3/4” thicker to give a little more room in the main storage compartment.
customer_reviews.author: Jeramyn Feucht

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, sleek, designed for success
customer_reviews.text: I like the thought put into this backpack, so efficient with the perfect spot for everything I need to put in it without wasted space. It is made for young professionals, yet I am still in school and it fits all of my needs as an engineering student, intern, researcher, and traveler. I was nervous of the brand at first (never hearing of them before), but am now a loyal customer.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Seeking

customer_reviews.title: Glad I spent the extra money for a quality bag
customer_reviews.text: One Month in, I'm extremely happy with this bag. It's comfortable, sturdy, and stylish. I have made great use of the individual pockets and compartments for all of my pens, business cards, headphones, and books, and the fact that my laptop sits in the middle of the bag makes me feel much safer lugging it around the city. The MVP of the backpack is the bottom hard-shell compartment: I use it for all my wires and delicate electronics, and it makes them incredibly easy to access while still holding them safely. I will update this review as time goes on: my biggest criticism of other backpacks has been their durability over time, but so far I'm feeling great.
customer_reviews.author: John Hardin

customer_reviews.title: This is such an amazing backpack. This is my second purchase (first one ...
customer_reviews.text: This is such an amazing backpack. This is my second purchase (first one was stolen). Very durable zippers, very stylish (I get lots of compliments for being a backpack). I needed something both as a student and as an instructor for my own business. Holds a lot of space and I like the container holder (used for coffee mug and get on scooter, doesn't budge). I use it with my ipad mini in the middle zipper and my surface book in the main compartment, then there is the open front that can carry so much more. I also use this as my carry item on airports which can hold your basics plus an extra change of clothes (minus jeans).
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Daniel Camba

customer_reviews.title: Compartments for travel documents!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this specifically for a two week Mediterranean cruise. Though I didn’t carry it on excursions, it was perfect for the airport and every other travel activity we had to do. The compartments were ideal for our passports and other important travel documents. It was my carryon and I used the compartment for cords and chargers for my sunglasses and prescription eye glasses. Easy to get into and easy to wear. Now that I’m back home, I use it daily for work! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Luvspugs

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bag. I travel a lot and I'm not ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bag. I travel a lot and I'm not sure how I got by without this all this time. Only thing from giving it a 5 star was the top handle had a small tip in it which will cause problems later but not worth going through the trouble to return it. I should but want to travel with it and am addicted now.
customer_reviews.author: Gunz 99

customer_reviews.title: A comfortable and good looking bag
customer_reviews.text: Love this backpack. Nice and slim, and very comfortable. Things I would like: - double zippers on the larger compartments. - a bit tricky for the zippers to turn the corner, even when the compartment is empty. - the chest band is OK. Didn't relieve the weight much in other areas. - side handle on both sides. - bottle container on the side is too loose. Lost a few water bottles already. Needs to be stretchy
customer_reviews.author: David A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Shoulder straps disconnect and fit nicely inside the provided slot if you want to get ...
customer_reviews.text: High quality. Well-thought out design. I can fit an umbrella in the water bottle slot on the side. Lots of handy litte compartments inside. One complaint: the sternum strap is sewn a tad bit too high. Even when it's adjusted to the lowest setting, it sits about right across my collar bones. Shoulder straps disconnect and fit nicely inside the provided slot if you want to get them out of the way (like when you are putting it under the seat in front of you on a flight.)
customer_reviews.author: Chevy

customer_reviews.title: My new everyday bag
customer_reviews.text: I take this bag with me almost everywhere. It houses my laptop, ipad, Nintendo Switch (sometimes), cable testing tools, hard drives, camera, my tech bag, misc cables, thumb drives, etc. everything has a spot and it's straps are comfy. I got caught in a late afternoon rainstorm in Florida and everything was dry, well except for me. :-) Great bag!
customer_reviews.author: Ravi

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far! I carry a MacBook Pro (13"), an iPad Pro, a solar panel, a battery pack, assorted cables and accessories for my Mac, and a notepad/portfolio and it all fits in this backpack! Interestingly though, I carry my Mac in the forward short space because my pad/portfolio is taller than my Mac, so I stick that in the laptop compartment. I like the fact that the iPad has it's own space in this pack! The protective pouch at the bottom is where I keep my battery pack. Yes, it looks professional and not like you're about to go hiking in the forest. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Ray Uyemura

customer_reviews.title: Great but....
customer_reviews.text: I had to give this bag the five stars because it is of great quality and good looks. Unfortunately too small for me and my current needs. I have to check and see if they make the same bag that is not so slim.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If your a business or student and travel lost, this is your backpack - bag!
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased multiple carry bags over the past few years for business and travel. The eBag backpack is everything all those other options I purchased were not. Well made, more than enough pocket and storage options. Fits my 13" DELL and my new 12.9" IPad Pro together with all my cables and accessories like a chart. And still room to spare. Should have purchased the eBag long agao, and saved me money and agrivation with those others!
customer_reviews.author: Stan L.

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't have been more pleased. I opted for the grey color and it ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been eyeing this bag forgoing on 2 years now. I finally decided to pull the trigger. I couldn't have been more pleased. I opted for the grey color and it simply looks stunning. It is extremely well made and the zippers are all the highest quality YKK zippers. This backpack has more than enough organization. If you have been on the fence about this one, pull the trigger like I did. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tedy D. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: eBag it - new bag fun
customer_reviews.text: at first-months use, the bag does as described. When you get a new bag with the specific storage like this one, you'll need to plan to re-adjust your workflow and content accordingly. I had my first trip with it two weeks ago and all things were smooth - nothing lost, nothing sagging, and the bag felt secure, stable and comfortable throughout the travels.
customer_reviews.author: Jascherm

customer_reviews.title: Stop looking, and buy this one.
customer_reviews.text: I just stopped in the midst of packing this backpack for the day and realized I need to write a review. I've had it for nearly a year. It is FANTASTIC. The build quality is top notch (equivalent to a Briggs Riley pack I had in the past, which was a ludicrous $250), the layout is ingenious, the various grab handles are super handy, and the structure is sturdy. The power electronics pocket at the bottom is a great idea, as is the water bottle pocket on the side. I use this thing every day and couldn't be happier. Buy one! If it ever wears out I'll buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Rigid.
customer_reviews.text: The bag seems to rigid. It keeps it shape when I filled with all my stuff. The straps that attach to the bag can be a tad bit wider because I feel it’s on the narrow side. The shoulder straps are comfy. It does what a back pack does. However, the selling point is how rigid the bag is. I feel that I can worry less if I drop my backpack while my laptop is inside. I use this for school, but when the semester is done I will definitely use this as a travel bag for my electronics. The compartments help keep the backpack organized.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: This backpack easily puts them to shame
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a huge fan over over-priced TUMI products. This backpack easily puts them to shame. Comfortable. Super well designed. Works great with several small biometric locks I've bought also on Amazon. Quality seems to be as high or superior to TUMI.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Solid and lots of room.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this bag. Fit's my 15" laptop and numerous cords and chargers without issue. Also can hold a lot of other things including my umbrella, ipad, and other work related items. Shoulder straps fit comfortably and the zippers are high quality. The only thing that keeps this from five stars is that the clever little drink holder on the side is a little shallow depending on the style/size of your travel mug. The mesh doesn't hold the travel mug well and I've had mine fall out more than once. Great idea, and clever look to it, but not a perfect execution.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Quality isn't there!
customer_reviews.text: I received this bag as a gift at Christmas. I do a lot of traveling and thought the quality would withstand the travel and I have been very disappointed. Stitching has already begun to unravel and the zippers are not working. Even though I do travel on a regular basis I am not rough with the bag to cause extra stress on the seams or zippers that are not functioning!
customer_reviews.author: Foster54

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Travelers Laptop Backpack
customer_reviews.text: A former coworker purchased this pack and I admired the sleek design. He pointed out the attributes of the backpack with the internal pockets. I especially like the flat bottom rigid shelf that prevents files and documents from bending as with most book bags. Having internal pockets and removable shoulder straps, the pack does not snag on airplane seats or overhead bins. I plan on purchasing one of the ebag cases as well.
customer_reviews.author: William Barrows

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, protects all my tech, everything I could ask for in one bag!
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for a long time now and it holds up very well. My large 17" MacBook Pro fits well in here and the foam protects it when I travel. I've simply used it for everything and it has a really great shape and style. The material lasts, and I've worn it in all sorts of weather with everything on the inside being dry. I can't imagine a better backpack!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Swan

customer_reviews.title: Well Built, great organization
customer_reviews.text: This bag is exactly what I was looking for! Fits my work laptop and iPad perfectly in separate compartments, has room for a notebook and. A few folders in the middle pocket. I really like the crushproof area which can actually fit quite a bit. I have my power brick, beats x headphone, wireless mouse and my eyeglasses in there with room to spare. Straps are comfortable and the chest strap is removable which was something I needed because they sometimes look silly. All in all a great bag for someone who travels and only wants to bring the necessities.
customer_reviews.author: Kvigil47

customer_reviews.title: Look and feel nice
customer_reviews.text: Well many things has been removed from the product. You can’t use it as messenger bag anymore. The hard box has been wiped out from it. More or less its not dual zipper anymore. Not sure, is it for the cost savings or something else, but not worth as per the paid price.
customer_reviews.author: SOUMYAJIT DHARA

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2 laptops no problem
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this bag for several months and multiple trips in which I packed a 17 inch gaming laptop in the back container and a 11 inch in the middle container without any problems. The 17 inch laptop just barely fits but squeezes in and has gotten looser as the fabric breaks in. The front area has separate pockets which are awesome for separating things like a mouse and spare hard drive. No issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Hot magma

customer_reviews.title: Tablet Pocket and more
customer_reviews.text: Did I really pick a bag based solely on it having it a separate pocket for a tablet? Ok, not the only thing... I also am a fan of Red Oxx Sky Train for its packable straps. Only a backpack when you need it to be. Rest of the time, 2 handles on top and side. So many pockets! The slim design and shape are very different. Got this after wearing out a Pelican camera/ laptop bag combo. The flap over the top type, so much wasted energy opening the flap, then having to flip it back to access front pocket. TLS Professional Slim - all avaiable at the top
customer_reviews.author: Tim Olson

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and professional looking backpack.
customer_reviews.text: Love the look of this bag. Love the compartment for cords - wish it were a bit bigger. The only drawback is that it is hard to pack a lot of stuff. I can add 2 laptops in the laptop section. I love the tablet pouch. The structure is rigid so stuffing it would compromise it's sleek look. All in all, I love this bag and am willing to sacrifice a bit on carrying capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: The bottom compartment to store a laptop power supply is a nice feature and accommodates the brick and cable for my ...
customer_reviews.text: Have been using it for a week. It seems to be well built and thought out. It is definitely slim compared to the Swiss backpack I used previously, but it still holds all the necessities. The bottom compartment to store a laptop power supply is a nice feature and accommodates the brick and cable for my Macbook Pro. It has padding and/or rigidity in the right places to protect laptop and tablet. It would be nice if the two large zippered areas had zippered side pockets within them. I'll probably end up using one or two mesh zippered pouches with it to better organize the various cables and adapters I carry with me.
customer_reviews.author: Cull Group

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bag
customer_reviews.text: Bag is full of useful pockets and such, the zippers and materials seem to be very high grade and the design is quite appealing. I've found the pouches a little tight for things like laptops and cables etc. Overall this is a great bag - it's larger than I thought so I'm glad I got the slim version, I can't imagine how big the larger one is. Love the side handle and the tuck-able shoulder straps, overall a great bag.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisJ

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it is a very good looking backpack
customer_reviews.text: I like eBags products. Funny though, this is my first original eBags product! But I really liked it. Nice, elegant, well designed, eBags DNA (mesh pockets, different compartments). The only thing I would have liked is they had it in two sizes: this one and a smaller one (height) for smaller laptops. But that is just something I would have liked and does not dimish a bit my praise to the backpack. The compartment design is great, allowing to distribute things not just pile them at the bottom; the small front compatment for accesories is a fantastic idea. It feels strong, sturdy, business-elegant..just great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So many pockets!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic design with great quality. The bag is adjustable to fit your needs. It holds alot while maintaining a slim look but dont expect it to expand very much. It works perfectly as a carry on bag, a backpack, and I've used it for overnight and two day trips.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Best Bag Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best work bag I've ever owned. I've owned a number of different bags over the year, each with their pros and cons. This is the first bag that truly incorporates many of the pros / items you'd be looking for in a laptop bag - whether it's for work, school, travel, or more. It's sleek, professional, has plenty of compartments, and great padding / protection. If you're looking for a dependable bag, with plenty of storage and tech padded compartments, then this is the bag for you. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Eugene O.

customer_reviews.title: A good bag for some, just not for me.
customer_reviews.text: This was a good bag but not one that fit my needs. As a Sales Engineer I travel with a lot of gear. This bag is designed for someone who is carrying a laptop, tablet and some accessories. I needed something that could hold those things as well as my cables, mini projector, blue tooth speaker, and more. If I just had the essentials this would have fit my needs. Thanks but I am still looking for my bag.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Lopez

customer_reviews.title: For those worried about what kind of laptop this bag can fit.
customer_reviews.text: See some reviews talking about laptops not being able to fit. I fit an Alienware 15 R4 in the main compartment and probably still had a tad bit of room to spare. That’s a meaty gaming laptop. I’ve had this bag for a hot minute and I’ve put it through the wringer. More severe use than most would and I haven’t had a single issue with it and it still looks new and is sitting beside me right now. It’s the best backpack I’ve ever owned. Don’t hesitate to put the money down for it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher C.

customer_reviews.title: I travel a lot and all my fellow road warriors ...
customer_reviews.text: I travel a lot and all my fellow road warriors swear by this bag. I had a Ghost that was heavy and I was getting grief for the internal battery by TSA. This bag is sleek and loaded with well designed compartments. I only use one strap so the fact that the other is tucked away and out of sight is a plus. Well worth the money and very thoughtfully designed for those who run the roads for a living.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey C

customer_reviews.title: Can't wait to use it!
customer_reviews.text: I just received my slim backpack and was concerned it would not be large enough for all of my work essentials. I just put everything in, including my somewhat larger laptop and it worked great. I believe there was a lot of research and thought put into where the pockets were placed and the size of each compartment. It seems like this will make me even more organized and it will make things easier to find while working. I like the graphite color because it is on trend and NOT BLACK like all of my previous laptop bags. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Dawg Fan

customer_reviews.title: Very solid but heavy bag
customer_reviews.text: Very solid bag, with very good protection for my laptops and tablets. Pockets are useful for sorting different small things, and the bottom pocket is good for holding power adapters, etc. But be careful of the following potential drawbacks before you buy it. - The capacity of holding things is limited. It is probably good for holding laptops and books. But not good for bigger objects that are not very flat. - The bag itself is quite heavy comparing to other backpacks.
customer_reviews.author: kid

product_meta.title: eBags Pro Slim Laptop Backpack (Brushed Indigo)
product_meta.description: Color:Brushed IndigoUPDATED DESIGN In response to customer feedback, this product was updated in 2019 to be more lightweight & user-friendly. Please see the updated Product Features, Images and Product Specifications. The eBags Professional Slim Laptop Backpack boasts supreme organization, unlike any other backpack you've ever seen. With a streamlined look and sophisticated design, this pack will take you everywhere you need to go from nine-to-nine, no pit-stops necessary. Featuring several padded tech pockets for all your devices and several internal and external pockets make this bag a dream come true. Plus, the vented airmesh back panel and contoured straps make for an incredible fit-absolutely ideal for a lengthy commute.
feature_bullets: KEY FEATURES: Padded laptop sleeve fits up to 17?, fleece lined padded tablet sleeve, side zip water bottle pocket and front bottom structured zip pocket
TRAVEL BENEFITS: Pass-through sleeve secures bag to rolling luggage and top carry handles
ORGANIZATION: Easy-access compartments; Front vertical exterior zip pocket; Diagonal stash pocket inside middle compartment
BREATHABLE & COMFORTABLE: Breathable, padded air-mesh back panel for comfort; removable, adjustable sternum strap
DIMENSIONS: Exterior Dimensions - 18" X 12.75" X 8.5"; Laptop Compartment Dimensions - 17.5" X 12.25" X 1.5"; Capacity - 1319 cu. in.; Linear Inches: 39.25"

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,795 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
